wikipedia_page.main: Queenie Leonard (born Pearl Walker; 18 February 1905 – 17 January 2002) was a British actress. She was the last surviving cast member of And Then There Were None (1945) until her death in 2002.

response: *February 18 – Queenie Leonard, British character actress and singer (d. 2002)

* Queenie Leonard as Lady Kensington who, alongside her husband, meets Louisa and Rod

Conway had supporting roles on The Betty Hutton Show television series (1959–60) and in the feature films The Atomic Submarine (1959), and 12 to the Moon (1960). He provided his voice for Disney's 101 Dalmatians (1961) as a quizmaster in What's My Crime?—a parody of the game show What's My Line?—and as a Collie that offers the Dalmatians shelter in a barn, later guiding them home. His wife at the time, Queenie Leonard, voiced a cow in the barn.
* Queenie Leonard as Daisy, the maid

link_mentions.page: List of Disney animated universe characters
List of minor characters in the Alice series
response: In the Disney movie, Alice meets them just before she meets the Caterpillar. They sing her a song called the "Golden Afternoon", from "All in the golden afternoon...". They are voiced by Lucille Bliss, Queenie Leonard, Doris Lloyd, Marni Nixon and Norma Zimmer.
*Queenie Leonard (1905-2002), stage name of English character actress and singer Pearl Walker
* January 17: Queenie Leonard, British actress (voice of bird in tree in Alice in Wonderland), Princess the puppy in One Hundred and One Dalmatians), dies at age 96.

link_mentions.page: And Then There Were None (1945 film)

response: Lanyard and Jamison are short of funds and when Ann Kelmscott (Nancy Saunders), the daughter of wealthy gem collector Sir John Kelmscott (Vernon Steele), invites them to the family estate, they agree. Sir John confides that he is in desperate need of money and asks Lanyard to arrange a confidential loan with part of his jewel collection as collateral. Jamison tells his master that Lily  (Queenie Leonard), the maid, told him the butler, Henry Robards (Tom Stevenson), is heartbroken because his former wife, actress Iris Chatham (Evelyn Ankers), has run off with Monty Beresford (Alan Napier) who financed the lavish stage production that launched Iris to stardom.
* Queenie Leonard as Lily, Kelmscott's Maid
*Queenie Leonard, 96, British character actress and singer.
